title: Controller
description:
**PureView Health Center** has career opportunities for a Full\-time ***Controller.*** Thisopportunity, located in Helena, Montana is within the Finance department and reports to the Chief Executive Officer.

**Make an Impact on Our Community**


PureView is dedicated to providing the communities we serve with quality, patient\-centered, accessible healthcare with comfort. We strive in each encounter to be the leading provider of the highest quality healthcare for our community regardless of a person’s circumstance.


At PureView, we value treating our patients, their families and our colleagues with compassion, kindness, and respect. We customize our care according to patient needs and values. And we believe in employing talented, skilled, caring, and responsible people. To us, treating each patient with dignity and as an individual is essential.

**The Opportunity**


Responsibilities of this career opportunity include serving as a key financial leader, responsible for the integrity, accuracy, and compliance of all accounting and financial reporting functions. This role provides both operational oversight and strategic financial partnership in a complex, federally funded healthcare environment. Working closely with the organization’s Fractional CFO during a transitional period, helping to strengthen financial infrastructure, enhance internal controls, and position the organization for continued growth. This individual will play a critical role in preparing the health center for future expansion and the eventual transition to an in\-house Chief Financial Officer.


This position requires strong nonprofit accounting expertise, experience in federally funded programs, and working knowledge of healthcare reimbursement systems, including Medicare and Medicaid.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Lead all accounting operations and monthly close processes
* Ensure GAAP\-compliant financial reporting and board\-level reporting
* Oversee HRSA Section 330 compliance and Uniform Guidance requirements
* Coordinate annual financial audit and Single Audit
* Support Medicaid/Medicare cost reporting and reimbursement oversight
* Strengthen internal controls and financial infrastructure
* Supervise and develop accounting staff


**Ideal Candidate Profile** Strong nonprofit and federal grant accounting experience

* Experience in healthcare, FQHC, or community health environments preferred
* Knowledge of HRSA and Uniform Guidance (2 CFR Part 200\)
* Medicare/Medicaid reimbursement familiarity
* ERP experience required; NetSuite strongly preferred
* CPA preferred


This role is well\-suited for a mission\-driven finance professional who enjoys building systems, improving processes, and contributing to the strategic growth of a healthcare organization serving Montana communities.


**Qualifications:**

**Required**

* Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or related field.
* Minimum of five (5\) years of progressive accounting experience.
* Strong knowledge of GAAP and nonprofit accounting standards.
* Experience managing federal grants and compliance requirements.
* Demonstrated success leading month\-end close and financial reporting processes.

**Preferred**

* Three (3\) or more years of supervisory or management experience.
* CPA designation or active CPA candidate.
* Experience in an FQHC, community health center, or nonprofit healthcare organization.
* Knowledge of HRSA regulations and Uniform Guidance (2 CFR Part 200\).
* Experience with Medicare/Medicaid reimbursement and cost reporting.
* Experience working in NetSuite or other enterprise\-level ERP systems (NetSuite strongly preferred).
* Familiarity with Montana healthcare reimbursement systems.

**Compensation**:


$125,000 – $165,000 annually


Compensation will be commensurate with experience, credentials, and demonstrated expertise in federally funded healthcare environments. Candidates with significant FQHC experience, deep knowledge of Section 330 compliance, Medicare/Medicaid cost reporting expertise, and multi\-site healthcare leadership experience may be considered toward the top of the range.

**What We Offer:**

* Meaningful work serving underserved communities
* Inclusive and team\-oriented workplace
* Competitive benefits package include:
	+ Medical, dental, and vision insurance
	+ 403(b) retirement plan with employer contribution
	+ Generous paid time off and paid holidays
	+ Continuing education and professional development support
	+ Potential relocation assistance

title: Fractional Chief Financial Officer (CFO)
description:
**About Ampleo**

**Cross\-Functional Leadership and Execution to Fuel Growth**

**We provide the expertise to accelerate your business at every stage and in every function.**

**Since 1996, Amplēo has helped thousands of businesses grow through on\-demand finance leadership, starting with fractional CFOs and outsourced controllers. What began as strategic financial support has evolved into a complete suite of cross\-functional services.**

**Today, Amplēo delivers embedded expertise in finance, HR, marketing, turnaround and restructuring, sales tax, and business valuation. Our professionals integrate directly into your team to provide both strategic insight and hands\-on execution, helping you achieve meaningful results faster.**

**We don’t just advise. We help you move, build, and win.**

 **Position Summary**


We are seeking an experienced Fractional CFO with deep experience in construction and/or home services (HVAC, plumbing, electrical, roofing, restoration, or similar trades) to serve as the acting CFO across multiple client companies.


This is a hands\-on leadership role, not an advisory position. You will step directly into the CFO seat, own the finance function, and partner with ownership and operations leaders to improve cash flow, margins, and operational performance.


This opportunity is ideal for a senior Controller, Director of Finance, or current Fractional CFO who already operates at a CFO level and wants broader exposure, flexibility, and meaningful impact across multiple organizations. The role is execution\-focused and relationship\-driven, requiring someone who can make decisions, build scalable financial infrastructure, and lead with authority.

 **Key Responsibilities**

* Serve as the financial leader for assigned client companies, providing hands\-on oversight of the finance function
* Translate financial data into actionable operational insights and strategic recommendations
* Own the financial narrative and reporting delivered to owners, lenders, and boards
* Build and maintain rolling cash flow forecasts aligned with backlog, project timing, labor requirements, and material costs
* Manage working capital, liquidity, and short\-term and long\-term cash planning
* Oversee job costing accuracy, WIP schedules, backlog reporting, and percentage\-of\-completion revenue recognition
* Monitor change orders, margin fade/gain, and project\-level cost performance
* Partner directly with operations leaders to improve job profitability and operational efficiency
* Lead the monthly close process and ensure accurate, timely financial reporting
* Deliver decision\-ready reporting packages and financial insights to leadership
* Develop and monitor KPIs related to labor efficiency, gross margin, overhead absorption, utilization, and backlog health
* Manage banking, lending, and bonding relationships and prepare financial reporting packages
* Participate in lender, investor, and board\-level financial discussions
* Improve financial processes, internal controls, and reporting infrastructure
* Optimize accounting, ERP, and job costing systems
* Support multi\-entity structures and scalable financial infrastructure
* Lead recurring financial review meetings with client leadership teams
* Present financial performance, risks, and opportunities with executive\-level clarity and confidence

### **Qualifications**

* Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting, Business Administration, or related field, or equivalent combination of education and relevant professional experience; CPA and/or MBA preferred
* Significant senior\-level finance leadership experience supporting commercial construction, general contracting, specialty trades, or home services organizations
* Demonstrated expertise in construction\-specific financial operations, including:
* + Job costing and project margin analysis
	+ Work\-in\-Progress (WIP) reporting and percentage\-of\-completion accounting
	+ Cash flow forecasting tied to backlog and project cycles
	+ Labor\-driven P\&L management
	+ Multi\-entity or complex operational environments
* Experience advising leadership teams within project\-based, contract\-driven revenue models
* Experience supporting companies typically ranging from $20M to $250M\+ in annual revenue
* Strong financial modeling, forecasting, and scenario\-planning capabilities within construction environments
* Working knowledge of GAAP and accounting standards applicable to construction entities
* Experience with ERP/accounting systems commonly used in construction (e.g., Sage, Foundation, Viewpoint, etc.)
* Demonstrated ability to provide strategic financial advisory services in a consultative capacity
* Strong communication and stakeholder engagement skills, with the ability to present financial insights to ownership, executives, and board\-level audiences
* Ability to operate independently, manage multiple client priorities, and deliver outcomes within evolving business environments

title: Controller, Outsourced Accounting (Nonprofit)
description:
AAFCPAs is an innovative and forward\-thinking firm. We have enjoyed primarily organic growth and continue our laser focus on sustained growth as an independent regional firm. We are considered an attractive alternative to the Big 4 and National CPA firms. We provide best\-value assurance, tax, outsourced accounting, business consulting, information technology advisory solutions, and wealth management services to nonprofit organizations, commercial companies, wealthy individuals, and estates. Since 1973, AAFCPAs sincere approach to business and service excellence has attracted discerning clients along with the best and brightest CPA and consulting professionals. AAFCPAs donates 10% of its net profits annually to nonprofit organizations. We have an active DE\&I committee and have commitment and accountability to these efforts.


AAFCPAs is an independent member of PrimeGlobal, the fourth largest CPA firm association in the world with 300\+ member firms in 80\+ countries. This provides our clients with seamless national and global coverage, along with an advantageous pay\-as\-you\-use model.

**Position:**


AAFCPAs is seeking a self\-directed, organized Controller to join our Outsourced Accounting and Fractional CFO Services (OAFC) team. The Controller is responsible for all areas of financial reporting for the 8\-10 MAS non\-profit clients assigned to them. This position will be responsible for developing and maintaining best practice accounting principles, practices, and procedures to ensure accurate and timely financial statements. A strong working knowledge of US GAAP is necessary. For the Nonprofit Controller position it is necessary to be proficient in areas of accounting and governance requirements that impact the Nonprofit Sector. The Controller supervises the MAS team members and is responsible for managing the team to ensure that work is properly allocated and delivered to the client in a timely and accurate manner. This position addresses tight deadlines and a multitude of accounting activities, including general ledger preparation, financial reporting, year\-end client tax and audit projects, and the support of budget and forecast activities. The Controller will have contact significant contact with clients as well as manage team members in the delivery of results. Reporting to a CFO and the Practice Leadership, the position provides financial management, financial reporting oversight, and consulting services to the clients of the MAS practice. Maximize return on financial assets by establishing and managing financial policies, procedures, controls, and reporting systems for clients. Internally, oversee staff and manage all aspects of engagements, including budgeting, resources, and billing. This job is currently being performed 100% remote; with the exception of in person participation at firm gatherings and professional development seminars.

**Other Responsibilities Include:**

* Provide financial consulting services to assigned clients, based on service agreements.
* For monthly accounting and reporting clients:
	+ Using technology and best practices, implement robust financial processes and reporting for clients.
	+ Oversee the team member’s daily activities of accounts payable, accounts receivable, cash disbursements, billing, general ledger, credits and collections on each client.
	+ Ensure accurate and timely recording of all transactions by implementing internal controls, checks and balances, and review of all transactional work performed for clients.
	+ Provide monthly analysis and financial statements to the client
	+ Act as client’s finance department including responding to questions, attending and presenting financial information at meetings, etc.
* For consulting clients:
	+ Through the utilization of experience, best practices, technology, and expertise within AAFCPAs, provide consulting services in a variety of areas, including:
		- Internal control analysis and recommendations
		- Processing and documentation for grant tracking, revenue recognition, departmental/divisional reporting, or other areas of need
		- Develop and implement budgeting, forecasting, or cash flow models
		- Provide audit or tax preparation services
		- Other areas as determined by engagement
* For all clients:
	+ Drive the client service delivery model, managing multiple clients and staff members
	+ Provide internal metrics to the CFO or Practice Leadership Team to measure productivity and results.
	+ Manage, train, and develop team in the delivery of services to clients
	+ Prepare estimated budgets for potential and existing client work and assist with the related proposal and/or engagement letter drafting
	+ Allocate appropriate resources to engagements and monitor and analyze against budgets and engagement letters
	+ Oversee, develop and work with client leadership on budgeting and planning processes for each client
	+ Prepare monthly billing to the client
	+ Set goals and complete performance evaluations to ensure on\-going performance expectations are met. Contribute to hire/fire staffing decisions for the team.
	+ Document policies and procedures

**KEY PERFORMANCE AND SUCCESS ATTRIBUTES**:

* Lead day\-to\-day follow through on team member deliverables
* On\-time delivery of client financial reporting packages
* Motivational and effective management skills
* Meeting assignment objectives (timeframes, budgets, outcomes)
* Ability to work independently in a sometimes stressful environment with extensive multi\-tasking demands
* Client satisfaction
* Participation in firm\-wide initiatives
* Learning and demonstration of evolving accounting and technology skills
* Ability to manage and motivate a team while delivering results to Clients.
* Superior ability to prioritize and focus in a high\-paced, multi\-tasking environment
* Ability to quickly learn and use new technology software applications

**QUALIFICATIONS**

* BS or BA in Accounting, MBA or CPA preferred
* 5 to 10 years’ experience
* Experience in private/public accounting working with nonprofit organizations
* Experience in financial data management and reporting
* Knowledge of advanced financial concepts, accounting principles, and standards, regulatory requirements, and processes in either the nonprofit area
* Experience with monthly accounting closing processes.
* Previous experience managing and developing staff

**\*\*****Please note that while this position is remote, occasional travel to client locations, corporate meetings and trainings may be required to facilitate effective collaboration and engagement implementation**.

title: Controller
description:
**Company Overview** 

JB Retail is a collection of premium retail brands differentiated by curated local product offerings and exceptional customer experience. Our retail portfolio, historically rooted in large, independent bookstores and gifting destinations with attached bistros (Joseph Beth Booksellers, Bronte Bistro), plus elevated hospital gift and coffee shops (Nurture and Nourish) that are redefining the market segment. Our regional footprint includes locations in Cincinnati/Cleveland (OH), Lexington (KY), New York City/Stony Brook (NY), and coming soon in Indianapolis (IN).

**Position Overview** 

The Controller leads and directs all accounting activities while maintaining accounting systems, procedures, and policies. Central responsibilities include monthly financial close and preparation of financial statements, treasury and cash management functions, AP/AR, tax \& regulatory compliance, inventory and expense management, and internal controls. Adjacent areas of responsibility include benefits administration, procurement, lease administration, and limited IT, security, and facilities responsibilities. The Controller reports directly to to JB Retail’s CEO and partners closely with its consulting (fractional) CFO as well as the Director of FP\&A.

**Major Responsibilities**

**Accounting, Financial Reporting, Auditing:**

* Lead all accounting operations, including general ledger, AP/AR, payroll, and fixed assets.
* Ensure timely and accurate monthly, quarterly, and annual financial close.
* Prepare GAAP\-compliant financial statements and supporting schedules.
* Maintain and continuously strengthen internal controls and financial policies.
* Oversee annual CPA review and income tax preparation.
* Responsible for technical accounting matters, including lease accounting and revenue recognition.
* Partner with FP\&A to ensure accuracy of reporting and integrity of budget vs. actual analysis.
* Oversee accounts payable and accounts receivable functions, ensuring cash is collected and applied accurately, vendor payments are made on time, aging items are monitored and resolved, etc.
* Maintain integrity of accounting systems, POS integrations, and financial reporting infrastructure.
* Identify and implement process improvements and automation opportunities and maintain documented SOP’s to support scalability and operational discipline.

**Inventory \& Margin Integrity:**

* Oversee retail and restaurant inventory accounting, partner with Operations and FP\&A on effective physical inventory processes and shrink analysis.
* Ensure accurate COGS and gross margin reporting, maintaining reconciliation between Celerant operating system and Sage financial system.
* Strengthen controls around purchasing, receiving, and cost tracking. Treasury \& Cash Management:
* Manage daily cash, including accounts payable, collections of accounts receivable, reconciling cash balances, funding of payroll, and forecasting cash needs.
* Manage banking and financing relationships, including depository and concentration accounts, operating line of credit, and construction financing. Ensure compliance with loan covenant and collateral base reporting requirements.
* Manage credit card approval and settlement processes, reconciling daily settlement amounts.

**Tax \& Regulatory:** 

* Responsible for tax filing, licensing, and other requirements, including oversight of sales and use tax, payroll tax, and income tax processes and remittances.
* Partner with HR to ensure all appropriate taxes, garnishments, and withholdings are executed through company payroll cycles (via ADP).
* Ensure compliance with all state registrations and licensing requirements.
* Monitor legislation that can affect business operations.

**Benefits Administration:** 

* Responsible for program design and provider selection (in partnership with HR, CFO, CEO) as well as administration of company benefits programs, including medical insurance, 401(k), etc.

**Lease Administration:** 

* Maintain up\-to\-date abstracts of all company real estate leases, including key lease attributes and financial commitments.
* Administer monthly rent payments and ensure all CAM, % rent, and other components are accurate and properly reconciled.

**Required Qualifications and Experiences:**

title: Controller
description:
**Who are we?**


Join us at the forefront of innovation in the AI sector. Our mission is to accelerate the future of work. We’re not merely envisioning the future; we’re actively constructing it. Our work is inspired by Ford’s assembly line and Ohno’s production system.

  

We are structured as an acquisition holding company and acquire controlling stakes in traditional business services companies to transform them with custom built AI solutions and operate them as subsidiaries.

  

We are based in Silicon Valley, Toronto, and Berlin and have raised significant funding to achieve our mission. Our founding team boasts a remarkable track record in the startup ecosystem, with each member having previously steered AI startups to unicorn status. As we write this new chapter in AI, we invite you to be part of this exciting journey and exceptional team that’s not just watching the future unfold but actively molding it.

  

We are looking for a Controller to be the financial backbone of our growing, multi\-entity organization. This is a high\-impact, hands\-on role for someone who thrives in an innovative and agile environment, not a role for someone who manages from a distance. You will own the books, build the infrastructure, and be a trusted strategic partner to leadership given our acquisition\-heavy strategy.

 **What's in it for you?**

* Ownership of the full accounting function at a high\-growth AI company from the ground up.
* A seat at the table with leadership—your work directly shapes company decisions.
* Collaborate with world\-class talent across engineering, product, investment, and operations.
* Competitive compensation and equity in a well\-funded AI startup.
* A fast\-moving, low\-bureaucracy environment where your expertise has immediate impact.

**What you will do**

* Own and manage the month\-end, quarter\-end, and year\-end close processes across multiple legal entities, ensuring accuracy, completeness, and timeliness.
* Maintain and oversee the general ledger (GL) system, including chart of accounts design, journal entries, reconciliations, and sub\-ledger integrations.
* Lead the consolidation of financial statements across multiple entities, including eliminations of intercompany transactions and currency translation adjustments.
* Prepare and present accurate, GAAP\-compliant financial statements (income statement, balance sheet, cash flow) to leadership and external stakeholders.
* Manage external fractional book keeping and accounting resources, who will report directly to you.
* Develop, implement, and enforce internal controls and accounting policies to ensure compliance and safeguard company assets.
* Partner with the Finance Lead, external resources, and the executive team to provide financial insights that inform strategic decision\-making.
* Own revenue recognition processes, ensuring compliance with ASC 606\.
* Oversee accounts payable, accounts receivable, payroll accounting, and treasury functions.
* Build and improve scalable accounting processes and workflows appropriate for a fast\-growing startup, balancing rigor with speed.
* Build out the accounting technology stack and team.
* Once our investors impose audit requirements, manage and coordinate the annual audit process, serving as the primary point of contact for external auditors.

* CPA required. Bachelor’s degree in Accounting or Finance; Master’s preferred.

* Exceptional attention to detail paired with the ability to prioritize and move quickly in an ambiguous, fast\-paced environment.

* Experience in a high\-growth technology or SaaS company environment.
* Familiarity with equity accounting, including cap table management and stock\-based compensation.
* Exposure to tax compliance, R\&D tax credits, or international tax structures.

This role is for someone looking to get in early at a high growth AI startup and heavily shape the future of our finance and accounting team, processes, and policies. You are the type of person who:

* Gets energy from building. You’d rather stand up a process from scratch than inherit a playbook.

Our best Captains don’t just deliver FOOS. They live it.

This role is for learners. Builders. Leaders who want to stretch and grow while helping families do the same.

Evident Change seeks a director of finance to coordinate and oversee our accounting and our financial planning and analysis operations, policies and procedures, reporting systems, and overall fiscal management. The director of finance will also work with the executive team to implement strategies that support the organization’s goals and priorities.  

  

Evident Change is not looking for a fractional employee with multiple employers in this field. We are seeking an individual interested in less than a full\-time but primary position with Evident Change.  

WHAT WILL YOU DO?
-----------------


Get ready to:  

* Lead Evident Change’s financial strategy, ensuring alignment with organizational goals.
* Oversee the full budgeting process, including annual planning, monthly monitoring, and reforecasting.
* Provide timely financial reporting and analysis to inform leadership decisions, including trends, forecasts, and major financial impacts.
* Maintain strong financial operations, including internal controls, policies, procedures, and compliance with relevant regulations.
* Manage key financial relationships and processes, including banking partners, outsourced accounting, and the annual audit.
* Oversee the financial performance management, including dashboards/metrics, departmental reviews, and coordination with finance staff and executives.

OUR COMPENSATION AND BENEFIT OFFERINGS
--------------------------------------


The national average salary for this three\-quarter\-time position ranges between $97,500 and $119,000 per year. Compensation is dependent on experience, parity with peers, and where an employee lives.  

Evident Change offers a monthly stipend to support our “work\-from\-anywhere” culture as well as other great benefits, including customizable medical, vision, and dental coverage. * CPA, CMA, or MBA preferred.

title: Executive Assistant
description:
**Building the financial operating system for healthcare, and bringing the** ***joy*** **back to healthcare by fixing the financial chaos behind it.**


The healthcare payment system is a complex and inefficient maze \- healthcare practices leave $125 billion in revenue uncollected each year, lost in the chaos of fragmented financial data, manual workflows, and opaque payer systems. This financial uncertainty leaves practices struggling to stay afloat, while valuable revenue slips through the cracks.


Joyful Health is building the AI\-powered financial operating system for healthcare practices. Our mission is to bring the joy back to running a private practice by simplifying financial operations so providers can focus on patient care. We spent 10 months working as fractional CFOs for a dozen practices, doing this work side by side with providers as we developed our product.


We just closed a funding round led by world\-class investors and angels including the founders of MongoDB \& KAYAK.


We have an enormous opportunity in front of us. The broken healthcare payment ecosystem impacts practices of all sizes, and the opportunity to make a real difference is massive.

**Role Description**
--------------------


Joyful Health is a small, fast\-moving startup, and we’re looking for an Executive Assistant to join our team in our New York office.

**This is a full time, in\-office role based in New York City,** and the physical presence is a meaningful part of the job: this person will own the day\-to\-day rhythm of our office environment and ensure it runs seamlessly.


The Executive Assistant will serve as a **force multiplier for Joyful Health's executive team and broader organization** — not just a support function for one leader, but a key operational partner who enables the entire leadership team to operate at their highest leverage. This role is well\-suited for someone proactive, highly organized, and comfortable operating with autonomy in a fast\-paced, growth\-stage startup.

***The base pay range for this role is $80,000 – $95,000 per year.***

**Key Responsibilities**
------------------------

* ***Recruiting \& Onboarding Administration*** Manage end\-to\-end recruiting logistics including candidate scheduling, onsite coordination, debrief scheduling, take\-home assignment tracking, and Slack channel setup. Support new hire onboarding to ensure a seamless and professional experience from offer through first week.
* ***Office \& Facilities Management*** Own day\-to\-day office operations: placing lunch orders, coordinating deliveries, stocking snacks and supplies, managing vendor relationships, and maintaining a productive and welcoming in\-office environment. Serve as the on\-the\-ground point of contact for anything the office needs to run well. Support IT setup and maintenance around the office — including phones, TVs, and conference room technology — ensuring equipment is functional and meetings run without friction.
* ***Team \& Event Coordination*** Support onsite and offsite logistics, plan and organize team bonding activities, coordinate swag ordering and distribution, and manage stakeholder gifting. As the team grows, help coordinate competing schedules for company\-wide meetings like All Hands and recurring team meetings.
* ***Go\-to\-Market \& Conference Support*** Support GTM and recruiting events end\-to\-end: sourcing venues, managing logistics, booking travel, coordinating materials and shipments, creating event pages, and tracking prospect and stakeholder meeting logistics.
* ***Meeting Operations*** Set up agendas for recurring operational meetings and track and distribute action items afterward. Support executive calendar management, ensuring leadership priorities are well\-organized and aligned across the team.
* ***Executive \& Communications Support***Draft and manage professional communications to external stakeholders including prospects, partners, and candidates. Support leadership with expense reporting, travel arrangements, and cross\-functional follow\-through.

**Required Skills**
-------------------


	+ Minimum 5\+ years of experience supporting senior executives or leadership teams.
	+ Experience working with a startup or technology company is a plus.
	+ Proficiency in Google Workspace, Microsoft Office, Slack, and common productivity tools.
	+ Professional communicator with excellent written and verbal English, including experience drafting external\-facing communications.
	+ Highly autonomous and proactive work style.
	+ Strong organizational and time management skills with very strong attention to detail.
	+ Adaptable and effective in a fast\-paced, growth\-stage environment.**Success in Role**
-------------------


	+ Reliable and proactive support across the executive team with minimal supervision.
	+ A well\-run office that leadership and staff don't have to think about.
	+ Smooth recruiting logistics with strong candidate and new hire experiences.
	+ Clear and professional external communications.
	+ Strong responsiveness and follow\-through across operational, recruiting, and GTM requests.**Working at Joyful**
---------------------


At Joyful Health, we're on a mission to fix one of the most broken systems in healthcare.


Learn more about our culture and how we do work at Joyful here!


Joining us means having the opportunity to make a direct, meaningful impact on the lives of clinicians and the financial health of their practices. Here's what you can expect from working with us:

**Meaningful Impact** You’ll be tackling one of the most complex challenges in healthcare—helping practices thrive in a chaotic financial landscape. Your work will directly contribute to solving one of the most hair on fire problems for providers, ensuring that they can focus on what they do best: caring for patients.

**Autonomy \& Ownership** As an early team member, you’ll have significant autonomy and the chance to shape our company from the ground up. You’ll have ownership over your work and the freedom to challenge the status quo in an environment that values initiative and creativity.

**Growth \& Learning** We’re a small, ambitious team with big goals, which means you’ll be constantly learning and growing. You’ll take on new challenges, expand your skill set, and have direct access to experienced founders and advisors who are invested in your development. We also offer stipends for professional development courses \& books (that we often will partake in together!) so we can all continuously grow.

**Competitive Compensation \& Equity** We believe that our team is our most valuable asset. We offer competitive compensation packages, strong equity, and the opportunity to share in the success of Joyful Health. We want you to feel supported, both financially and professionally, as we grow together.

**Be Your Best Self** We provide the benefits you need to stay happy and healthy, including comprehensive healthcare benefits, unlimited PTO (with a minimum of 10 days off a year), and flexibility so you can take care of yourself. We also organize regular team off\-sites and events to ensure that even as we tackle big problems we enjoy the journey.

description:
TriNet is a leading provider of comprehensive human resources solutions for small to midsize businesses (SMBs). We enhance business productivity by enabling our clients to outsource their HR function to one strategic partner and allowing them to focus on operating and growing their core businesses. Our full\-service HR solutions include features such as payroll processing, human capital consulting, employment law compliance and employee benefits, including health insurance, retirement plans and workers’ compensation insurance.  

  

TriNet has a nationwide presence and an experienced executive team. Our stock is publicly traded on the NYSE under the ticker symbol TNET. If you’re passionate about innovation and making an impact on the large SMB market, come join us as we power our clients’ business success with extraordinary HR.  

  

**Don't meet every single requirement? Studies have shown that many potential applicants discourage themselves from applying to jobs unless they meet every single requirement. **A Brief Overview**  

As an Administrative Services Outsourcing (ASO) Sales Consultant, you will help power business success with extraordinary HR by working with our current SaaS client base to uncover and close upsell opportunities increasing revenue and grow revenue. You will also prospect and build your own book of business for ASO in assigned markets, own your opportunities, and execute the sales process. In an effort of exceeding quota, you will build pipeline, conduct sales meetings with prospective clients via video conferencing and in person, write proposals, gain approvals, and present those proposals to prospective clients, including C\-level executives, business owners and other decision makers in midsize businesses.

* Plan: Develop an annual plan to hit targets in assigned market territories, may cover multiple states and/or regions and manage a diverse portfolio of industries within TriNet assigned verticals.

Consistently work on building a balanced pipeline of target prospects through traditional means of prospecting (email, phone, LinkedIn) and working withing assigned accounts in specific geographic areas.
* Needs analysis: Understanding the specific administrative challenges faced by prospective clients to tailor the outsourcing solution to their needs. Strong understanding of target emerging market and decision\-making personas will help to qualify or disqualify quickly.
* Presenting solutions: Demonstrating how TriNet’s administrative services can address client pain points and improve efficiency, including cost savings and quality control.
* Sales cycle management: Utilize a sophisticated and multi\-step selling process with defined criteria, executive sponsorship, and internal business processes. Managing the entire sales process from initial contact through proposal development, negotiation, and closing deals.
* Relationship building: Establish a trusted advisor relationship, both internally at TriNet and within the prospect’s decision\-making system, to effectively gain successful business and long\-term client relationships.
* Account management: Ongoing communication with clients to ensure satisfaction with the outsourced services and identify potential opportunities for expansion.
* Partnership Skills: Strong partnering skills, both from an inside perspective working with the field organization to drive leads to close, plus the ability to partner outside the organization with partners like CPA’s, Brokers, Fractional CFOs, and others.
* Sales Tools and Systems: Utilize Sales systems including Salesforce.com, LinkedIn Sales Navigator, ZoomInfo and quoting tools to manage daily activities efficiently and effectively.
* Performs other duties as assigned
* Complies with all policies and standards


**Education Qualifications**


* Bachelor's Degree or equivalent experience preferred


**Experience Qualifications**


* Typically 3 plus years working with a B2B, selling in one of the following industries is a plus: HCM, SaaS, HRO, Cloud, ERP, HRIS, technology, or financial services required
* Proven PEO, SaaS, HCM and/or ASO experience preferred


**Skills and Abilities**


* Strong phone\-based development skills required.
* Ability to conduct online demos and virtual meetings.
* Ability to work within a team environment.
* Success with complex, consultative, C\-level sales.
* Strong business acumen and P\&L analysis.
* Strong understanding of financial concepts allows you to quantify benefits for your customers specific to their business.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills, interpersonal skills, and presentation skills.
* Ability to build your own book of business from prospecting, sourcing, establishing, and maximizing partner and referral networks.
* Ability to communicate with employees at all levels of the organization.
* A demonstrated commitment to high professional ethical standards and a diverse workplace.
* Ability to build strong ecosystem partnerships and business referral relationships to share the value and mission of TriNet.
* Ability to adapt to a fast paced continually changing business and work environment while managing multiple priorities.
* Experience with technology and common software and web applications, including MS Office and Salesforce.com or comparable CRM.


**Work Environment**


* Work in clean, pleasant, and comfortable office or home setting. The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable persons with disabilities to perform the essential functions.


The salary range for this role is $60,000\.00 to $88,000\.00\. The candidate’s final salary offer will be based on the candidate’s skills, education, work location and experience.



Candidates hired into roles in the sales organization are also eligible for commissions consistent with TriNet’s commission plan.



Additionally, subject to applicable eligibility requirements, TriNet offers permanent full\-time employees a variety of benefits including medical, dental, and vision plans, life and disability insurance, a 401(K) savings plan, an employee stock purchase plan, eleven (11\) Company observed holidays, PTO and a comprehensive leave program.
